Point and tuple helper functions¶

spyral.point.add(p1, p2)[source]¶

Computes p1 + p2.

spyral.point.angle(p)[source]¶

Calculates the angle that p makes with the x axis, in radians.

spyral.point.bounding_rect(l)[source]¶

Computes a bounding rectangle from an iterable of tuples (x,y).

spyral.point.dist(p1, p2)[source]¶

Calculates the distance between two points.

spyral.point.dist2(p1, p2)[source]¶

Returns the square of a distance between two points

spyral.point.polar(p)¶

Converts rectangular coordinates to polar. Returns (r, theta).

spyral.point.rectangular(r, theta)[source]¶

Converts polar coordinates to rectangular.

spyral.point.rotate(p, angle, center=(0, 0))¶

Rotates p around center by angle.

spyral.point.scale(p, scale)[source]¶

Scales p by (scale_x, scale_y).

spyral.point.snap_to_grid(p, size)¶

Finds the nearest grid point to p. Allows a uniform size, or a tuple of sizes for each axis.

snap_to_grid((x,y), 16) snap_to_grid((x,y), (16, 8))

spyral.point.sub(p1, p2)[source]¶

Computes p2-p1.

spyral.point.unscale(p, scale)[source]¶

Scales p by (1/scale_x, 1/scale_y).
